thread.title: NIC-10 football: Pretzels seek playoffs; Auburn chases history
thread.title_full: NIC-10 football: Pretzels seek playoffs; Auburn chases history

author: Matt Trowbridge
title: NIC-10 football: Pretzels seek playoffs; Auburn chases history
text: Records: Guilford 4-4; Hononegah 5-3 Last week: Guilford lost 28-0 to Auburn; Hononegah lost 22-17 to Harlem Last meeting: Hononegah 42, Guilford 7 Fast facts : Hononegah has beaten Guilford eight years in a row in the regular season by a combined 264-89, but Guilford won 14-0 in the 2007 playoffs. Guilford’s last regular-season win over the Indians was 49-12 in 2006. ... Hononegah had a 42-0 lead and a running clock in the third quarter last year. ... Guilford needs to beat Hononegah to avoid missing the playoffs for the fourth time in five years since its school-record of seven straight playoff appearances was snapped. ... Christian Fausel (609 yards), Mike Jacobs (468) and Dallas Washington (363) give Hononegah a balanced rushing attack. Belvidere at East Records: Belvidere 5-3; East 1-7 Last week: Belvidere beat Freeport 20-19; East lost 39-24 to North Last meeting: Belvidere 46, East 18 Fast facts : Belvidere’s 29 consecutive wins over East is a NIC-10 record, passing Boylan’s 27 consecutive wins over Harlem from 1978-2004 and three ahead of Boylan’s current 26-game streak against Jefferson. ... East last won 35-22 in 1985, the year the E-Rabs won their second state title. ... Belvidere had two drives over 10 minutes last week, including a 14-minute drive it didn’t score on. ... Brett White’s interception in the final minute sealed Belvidere’s one-point win over Freeport. ... Bucs QB Austin Revolinski ran for 143 yards vs. Freeport and ranks fifth in the league in rushing with 613 yards; his 690 passing yards rank fourth. He has completed 57 percent of his passes (53 of 93). Page 3 of 3 - Boylan at North When: 7:15 p.m. Friday Records: Boylan 2-6; North 6-2 Last week: Boylan beat Jefferson 45-28; North beat East 39-24 Last meeting: North 27, Boylan 19 Fast facts : Boylan is 8-1 vs. North, including a 35-17 playoff win in 2013. ... Last year’s North win means every NIC-10 team has now beaten every other league team at some point. ... North has also had three close calls against Boylan, losing 19-14 in 2009 when it led with six minutes to go, 21-13 in 2008 and a 38-34 loss in 2013 when Boylan scored with 75 seconds left. ... Boylan led 12-0 at one point last year, trailed by one one until the final two minutes and reached the North 15-yard line in the waning seconds against the 2014 co-conference champs. ... Boylan outgained North 367 yards to 325 last year. ... North could still tie for the conference title if Auburn loses. Harlem at Jefferson Records: Harlem 6-2; Jefferson 0-8 Last week: Harlem beat Hononegah 22-17; Jefferson lost 45-28 to Boylan Last meeting: Harlem 52, Jefferson 7 Fast facts: Harlem has beaten Jefferson 18 years in a row since the J-Hawks won 21-20 in 1995. ... The average score the last 10 games has been Harlem 48, Jefferson 11. ... Jefferson has lost 26 games in a row. ... Jefferson had its best passing game last week, throwing for 150 yards, and De’Gyon Macklin ran for 164 yards on 22 carries. ... Jefferson is last in the NIC-10 in both offense (68 points) and defense (331 points). ... Brenton Shaw leads the NIC-10 with 1,312 yards and 10 touchdowns rushing and needs 110 yards to break Kevin Witcik’s 2012 school record of 1,421 yards in a season. ... Harlem’s Trent Willey is second in the NIC-10 in passing with 798 yards. He is 71 of 137 and leads with eight TD passes.
